text:
Mile Nedelkoski () (November 25, 1935 – June 21, 2020) was a Macedonian poet, novelist, storyteller, and playwright.
He was known for being a bulgarophile intellectual. Nedelkoski was born in Prilep, Kingdom of Yugoslavia. He was an editor at Kultura press. He became a member of the Macedonian Writers' Society (, ДПМ) in 1963.
Nedelkoski died on June 21, 2020 in Skopje, North Macedonia at the age of 84.
